channel.title: Pygame
channel.description:
hello i have a few questions about pygame
a friend told me that pygame is a great place for making games :) but i dont know what i am going to download since i have ubuntu 9.10 and i dont know what i do when i get the download? and how does this program work?
please somone help me

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:16, topic:323889”]yeah thats me th fucking ideot that do not knows anything
can somone answer me that i understands what to do?[/quote]

Pygame is an addon to a programming language. That programming language is Python. If you want to learn how to write programs and games with python, and eventually use the pygame “library,” go to this website: http://wiki.python.org/moin/BeginnersGuide

Programming games is NOT easy, especially for a new programmer. I suggest you go to that website, study up on the python programming language, and get good at the python programming language BEFORE using the pygame library.

Read full topic

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve never used pygame or OGRE, but I have used Panda3D, and it is fairly good. I’ve made a few games in it for a class, and released a few of the bettor ones, but not the best one yet, on here.

Read full topic

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:15, topic:323889”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=420293.msg3089760#msg3089760 date=1262808471]

Pygames suck tbh, I think it would be better if you just learned python ogre instead of wasting time on pygames.

They have entirely different purposes you moron. You can’t make a 2D game with OGRE, and OGRE is not a game engine or library, it’s purely a 3d rendering engine.

And judging by OP’s posts, he should not start with a 3D game.
[/quote]judging by OP’s posts, he’s probably a fucking idiot thinking it’s a game itself and unaware that the library is to help him program one[/quote]

yeah thats me th fucking ideot that do not knows anything
can somone answer me that i understands what to do?

Read full topic

Pygames suck tbh, I think it would be better if you just learned python ogre instead of wasting time on pygames.
[/quote]
They have entirely different purposes you moron. You can’t make a 2D game with OGRE, and OGRE is not a game engine or library, it’s purely a 3d rendering engine.

And judging by OP’s posts, he should not start with a 3D game.[/quote]judging by OP’s posts, he’s probably a fucking idiot thinking it’s a game itself and unaware that the library is to help him program one

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Erj:

Pygames suck tbh, I think it would be better if you just learned python ogre instead of wasting time on pygames.

They have entirely different purposes you moron. You can’t make a 2D game with OGRE, and OGRE is not a game engine or library, it’s purely a 3d rendering engine.

And judging by OP’s posts, he should not start with a 3D game.

Read full topic

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:10, topic:323889”]ok but where is the game after i downlaoded?
i got downloaded it :)[/quote]

As Unhandled said, it is a library. A library contains multiple methods, or you may hear them called functions, to assist in writing programs. So if there was a part of a program called displayOnScreen in the library, you could use the function defined in the library instead of coding it yourself.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“kneistol, post:8, topic:323889”]and unhandled i cant get the command work it only says E: couldn’t find the pygame package
:([/quote]
Try this:

sudo apt-get install python-pygame

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

PyGame is simply a set of modules that work around and on SDL. It’s known for simplicity, which would be a plus for someone with no real knowledge of Python, but as Erj already said I personally would go with Python-ogre.

You’ll need to get Python from www.python.org and then PyGame from www.pygame.org, if you need any help don’t hesitate in asking super_.

Read full topic

item.title: Pygame
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

Pygame is an python oriented engine if I’m not mistaken. Anyways, in order to program or make your games you simply need to learn the python programming language. I’m studying it as we speak.

Python.org

Welcome to Python.org

The official home of the Python Programming Language

and cowie’ recommended me to use this awhile back; http://www.python-ogre.org/ for better results for game creating.

To get you started: http://www.swaroopch.com/notes/Python

Read full topic
